summary: This document consists of multiple photo sheets from the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York, documenting a possible suicide attempt involving inmate Jeffrey Epstein on July 23, 2019, and a related incident involving his cellmate Nicholas Tartaglione. The sheets record the time, location, and photographic documentation of the incidents.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The primary subject of the incident report, listed as inmate #76318-054 involved in a 'Possible Suicide Attempt' in the Special Housing Unit on July 23, 2019.

persons.name: Nicholas Tartaglione
persons.context: Listed as inmate #78514-054 and identified as Epstein's cellmate. He is the subject of separate photo sheets for a 'Possible Suicide Attempt(Cellmate)' incident occurring at the same time and location.

connections.description: Both were inmates in the Special Housing Unit at MCC New York and were involved in related incidents reported at the same time.

events.title: Possible Suicide Attempt at MCC
events.description: A reported 'Possible Suicide Attempt' involving inmate Jeffrey Epstein in the Special Housing Unit of the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, at approximately 1:27 AM.

events.title: Cellmate Incident Report
events.description: A related 'Possible Suicide Attempt(Cellmate)' incident report for Nicholas Tartaglione, Epstein's cellmate, filed for the same time and location.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, N.Y.
Special Housing Unit, Metropolitan Correctional Center
keyFacts: The document records a 'Possible Suicide Attempt' involving Jeffrey Epstein on July 23, 2019, at 1:27 AM in the Special Housing Unit of the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York.
A separate but related set of photo sheets documents a 'Possible Suicide Attempt(Cellmate)' for Nicholas Tartaglione (inmate #78514-054) at the same time and location, indicating they were cellmates.
The incidents were photographed shortly after they were reported, with photos of Epstein taken around 1:45 AM and 1:55 AM, and photos of Tartaglione taken around 2:25 AM.
The document is a formal institutional record created by the Special Investigative Section of the MCC Lieutenant's Office, cataloging the initial response to the incidents.
